Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partly grey in section, the interior is covered with a brown deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.187)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36442) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36442)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 300 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13488 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
